project__PROJECT_TITLE: Review of the published exposure data on pesticides for residents and bystanders and for environmental risk assessment.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The purpose of this assignment is to collect all data published in the last 25 years (from 1.1.1990 onwards) on: — resident and bystander exposure to pesticides, including references made in the public consultation to the EFSA GD and the collection and analysis of data produced and available to international organisations (e.g. US EPA), — daily air concentrations of substances based on vapour pressure, — drift values from spray, seed and granular applications through collection and analysis of published papers and other data available through e.g. grey literature, — dislodgeable foliar residue (DFR) through collection and analysis of published papers and other data available through e.g. grey literature.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Food chain analysis of selected aquaculture species products: identification and monitoring of vulnerabilities and drivers of change for the identification of emerging risks.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: Results from this project should provide indications on the applicability of the food chain analysis for the identification of vulnerabilities and emerging risks on selected species from the fish saltwater aquaculture in order to inform and target EFSA emerging risk intelligence gathering activities. In addition, results from this project should allow interested decision-makers to tailor management strategies for mitigating actions.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Database on the taxonomical identification and potential toxigenic capacities of non-QPS production strains of industrially produced food and feed additives.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to conclude a direct contract for the preparation of a database from a review on the taxonomical identification and potential toxigenic capacities of microorganisms used for the industrial production of feed additives and food enzymes.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_ADDRESS1: Parque tecnológico de Valencia, Avinguda de Benjamin Franklin, 5–11

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Human biomonitoring data collection from occupational exposure to pesticides.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The main objective of the procurement is to review available information (from 1990 onward) on human biomonitoring (HBM) of pesticides (or metabolites) in occupational settings and collect data from HBM studies/surveillance programmes.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_ADDRESS1: Farthing Green House, 1 Beccles Road, Norfolk

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Data collection for the estimation of ecological data (specific focal species, time spent in the treated areas collecting food, composition of diet), residue level and residue decline of pesticides on food items to be used in risk assessment for birds and mammals.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The main objectives of the contract resulting from the present procurement procedure are to collect and harmonise: (i) the available ecological data (e.g. focal species per geographical area and crop, time spent in treated areas collecting food (PT), diet composition data obtained in the treated areas (PD)); (ii) data from residue trials including both residue levels and residue decline to be used for risk assessment of birds and mammals under the regulatory framework of Regulation (EC) 1107/2009 of the European Parliament and of the Council.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: Alterra (Institute within the legal entity Stichting DLO — Wageningen University); AGES and ANSES

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Purchase of document delivery services.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: Provision of a wide range of published papers, mainly related to scientific fields (STM scientific, technical and medical subjects) with a minority related to legal/IT/management issues. The documents could be: articles (from a wide range of academic journals including scanned documents from sources that only exist in hard copy format) and book chapters in published literature; articles and book chapters from rare publishers, grey literature such as scientific and technical reports; proceedings; dissertations; Bibra toxicity profiles; ISO, UN-ISO, UNI-EN-ISO documents. These documents must be provided in electronic format; PDF is the preferred format. — The provision of a Web-based interface (hosted by the supplier's server) that EFSA scientific staff (250 more or less) can access using a personal profile to browse the bibliographic database of the supplier (connected to publishers' websites and databases) and order articles. — A high level of customer service to assist EFSA with administrative and technical issues.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Biological relevance of the magnitude of effects (considering mortality, sub-lethal and reproductive effects) observed in studies with amphibians and reptiles in view of population level impacts on amphibians and reptiles.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: In order to support the development of a sound and robust scientific risk assessment scheme it is necessary to collect information on the biological relevance of effects (e.g. mortality, sub-lethal and reproductive effects) observed in laboratory studies in view of population-level impacts on amphibians and reptiles. The aim is to have a basis for suggesting extrapolation factors for future risk assessment schemes. The collected data will later on be used to make a link between effects observed in the laboratory studies to population-level effects and to establish a basis for deriving trigger values for first-tier assessments which are based on laboratory studies.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: University of Koblenz-Landau UNI-KO-LD, in consortium with University of Aveiro Portugal

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Literature review of baseline information to support the risk assessment of RNAi-based GM plants.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The subject matter of the contract is the literature review of scientific information on RNAi to support the molecular characterisation of RNAi-based GM plants.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: Institute of Molecular Genetics of the Academy of Sciences of the Czech Republic (IMG)/EcoMole Ltd

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Data collection, literature review and spatial models for virus spread in preparation to the mandate on avian influenza’.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objective of the contract resulting from this procurement procedure is to carry out collection of data from past EU outbreaks of AI, literature reviews on the introduction of AI in the EU and the development of spatial models for the spread of AI into EU poultry holdings.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Canteen, cafeteria and catering services and supply of coffee and other drinks for meetings.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The scope of this invitation to tender is to enter into a framework contract and service concession for 1 year + automatic renewal up to 3 times to give a maximum term of 4 consecutive years with an economic operator able to provide the following: A) at the headquarters of the European Food Safety Authority (EFSA), via Carlo Magno 1/A, Parma: — canteen and cafeteria services, — water coolers (including bottles) on floors and in meeting rooms; B) at the EFSA headquarters, via Carlo Magno 1/A and/or at the Palazzo Ducale, Parma: — coffee and other drinks for meetings, — catering service for events.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Assistance to the Assessment and Methodological Support Unit for the provision of services to EFSA on R coding, programming, ad hoc R consultation (bug fixing, convergence issues faced, code optimisation), and the provision of a scalable high-performance computing environment upon request.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The objectives of the contract resulting from the present procurement procedure are as follows: 1. development of Web interfaces and a platform to host Web applications; 2. to provide scalable high-performance computing (HPC) infrastructure; 3. to foresee potential needs for R knowledge updates (training on R programming) in-house; 4. ad hoc consultancy.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Support to national dietary surveys in compliance with the EU menu methodology (fifth support).
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to award direct service contracts to organisations from EU Member States, and from Iceland, Norway and Switzerland, which have a governmental mandate to carry out a dietary survey at national level in the period from 2015 to 2020 and a national dietary survey has not been carried out within the country in the last 5 years for the planned target group. Under the resulting contracts the contractor(s) should either adapt or develop the methodology to be used in these surveys according to the EFSA guidance on the EU menu methodology. The dietary data collected through the contracts should be available for EFSA's scientific activities without restrictions on its use.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Support to national dietary surveys in compliance with the EU menu methodology (fifth support).

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Modelling population dynamics of aquatic and terrestrial organisms using dynamic energy budget (DEB) models: application to risk assessment of chemical mixtures.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objectives of the contract resulting from the present procurement procedure is to model population dynamics of aquatic and terrestrial organisms using DEB models and explore their potential applications for the ecological risk assessment of combined exposure to multiple chemicals ‘chemical mixtures’.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Development of a consolidated database covering EFSA pesticide outputs on active substances.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objective of this call is the development and the completion of a searchable database covering the relevant pesticides' active substances outputs/endpoints. The database should also include the available information on relevant metabolites and relevant impurities as available for each active substance. The database should be flexible, allowing EFSA to include, in the future, additional fields and adaptations to the scientific and regulatory process.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Pilot project on the implementation of SSD2 in the frame of the electronic transmission of harmonised data collection of analytical results to EFSA.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The current call for tenders is a continuation of the previous one and aims to complete, extend and include an additional domain in the pilot implementation of SSD2 in order to facilitate the future adoption and implementation of SSD2 as a unique data model for different collections.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Assistance to the Assessment Methodology Unit for statistical analyses, data management and ad hoc consultation upon request.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The framework contractors selected must be able to conduct specific statistical and data management tasks and training courses upon request. Such tasks may include data analysis, data management, statistical or mathematical modelling, simulation modelling, computational support, and methodological consultations or training. This may require the processing and loading of data in various formats (e.g. structured text files, SAS datasets, Excel spreadsheets, XML, MS Access and Oracle databases) and the use of specific software (e.g. R, WinBUGS, SAS, etc.).

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Implementation and testing of electronic submission in XML format of zoonoses, antimicrobial resistance and food-borne outbreak data and updating the historical datasets.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to award direct contracts for the execution of specific tasks over a clearly defined period defined in the tender specifications. Direct contracts will be awarded to organisations from EU Member States and other reporting countries (Albania, the former Yugoslav Republic of Macedonia, Iceland, Liechtenstein, Montenegro, Norway, Serbia and Switzerland) which have a governmental mandate to report data on zoonoses, antimicrobial resistance, food-borne outbreaks and animal populations in accordance with Directive 2003/99/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Selection of a medical adviser for the European Food Safety Authority.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to conclude a framework contract for 4 years with 1 contractor for the provision of the services: a) pre-employment medical visits; b) annual medical visits; c) occupational health; d) travel medicine; e) infirmary; f) committees and networking; g) administrative management; h) reports; i) ad hoc consultancy.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Insurance services for EFSA.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this contract is to enter into a framework service contract with an insurance company that can provide insurance cover as described in Annexes 7.1 All risks for electronic devices — 7.2 Theft and robbery involving movable goods — 7.3 Fire and additional risks for movable and immovable assets.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Management consultancy services.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: This tender aims at providing to EFSA management a multi-annual block of management consulting services related to business transformation and operational development relevant to improving EFSA's value, effectiveness and efficiency.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Training courses on expert knowledge elicitation.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: Overall objectives: — establish standardised, easily accessible Web-based training (self-paced e-learning) (cp. lot 1) to ensure that all experts who are elicited or involved in an expert knowledge elicitation, have a common understanding of the background of the methodology applied, — conduct training for EFSA experts from the Scientific Committee, EFSA panels and their working groups, as well as EFSA staff on how to steer an expert knowledge elicitation (cp. lot 2) to foster the use of the methodology.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Training courses on expert knowledge elicitation.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: Overall objectives: — establish standardised, easily accessible Web-based training (self-paced e-learning) (cp. lot 1) to ensure that all experts who are elicited or involved in an expert knowledge elicitation, have a common understanding of the background of the methodology applied, — conduct training for EFSA experts from the Scientific Committee, EFSA panels and their working groups, as well as EFSA staff on how to steer an expert knowledge elicitation (cp. lot 2) to foster the use of the methodology.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Electronic journals, electronic databases and books/e-books acquisition.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The objective of the present procurement procedure is to select 1 tenderer for 1 or more lots for purchasing the items listed in the lots below: e-journals (collections and single titles) from different publishers; e-databases from different providers and books/e-books from different publishers and from different countries to minimise the administrative overheads and streamline the purchase procedures: This tender is divided into the following 4 lots: — lot 1: e-journals, — lot 2: e-databases — ISI Web of Science, — lot 3: e-databases — Scopus, — lot 4: books and e-books.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Integrating toxicokinetics in chemical risk assessment: application to human, animal and environmental risk assessment.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objective is to develop tools and models to integrate TK data and predict TK parameters for human health, animal health and environmental risk assessment of single and multiple chemicals.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: La-ser Europe Ltd & Ineris France & Stichting Universiteit
institution_data__INSTITUTION_ADDRESS1: International House, Paddington Street, 66 Chiltern Street

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Quantitative and qualitative target audience research.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The objectives of the contract resulting from the present procurement procedure are as follows: 1. to ensure that EFSA has access to the provision of a full range of qualitative and quantitative research services in the following areas: — reviews (desk research), — primary research (collection and analysis of new data), — secondary analysis of existing data, — evaluation; 2. establishment of a reputation barometer that will regularly seek target audience perceptions of the European Food Safety Authority.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Quantitative and qualitative target audience research.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The objectives of the contract resulting from the present procurement procedure are as follows: 1. to ensure that EFSA has access to the provision of a full range of qualitative and quantitative research services in the following areas: — reviews (desk research), — primary research (collection and analysis of new data), — secondary analysis of existing data, — evaluation; 2. establishment of a reputation barometer that will regularly seek target audience perceptions of the European Food Safety Authority.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Preparation of summary reports from dossiers on food enzymes from genetically modified microorganisms (GMM) or genetically modified plants.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The objective is to prepare summary reports of the information contained in the dossiers regarding the genetically modified production organism such as plant or basidiomycete or microbial sources. In the latter case information about the strain and its genetic stability, pathogenicity and toxigenicity will need to be summarised. As stipulated in the guidance document from the GMO panel on the risk assessment of genetically modified microorganisms and their products intended for food and feed use additional information to that provided in the technical part of the dossiers requested if the source material is a GMM.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: National Food Institute, Technical University of Denmark (DTU)

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Transformation and further development of the compendium of botanicals reported to contain naturally occurring substances of possible concern for human health when used in food and food supplements.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objective of this procurement is to transform and further develop the EFSA compendium of botanicals reported to contain naturally occurring substances of possible concern for human health and increase its usefulness for competent authorities in EU Member States and other interested parties.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: Institute of Chemical Technology Prague, Techem CZ, s.r.o.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Review of literature on cyanobacteria toxins in food.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The overall objective of this procurement is to critically review available literature with the aim to gather information and evaluate the evidence for the occurrence of cyanotoxins in food (including supplements), their toxicological relevance, possible exposure scenarios from food consumption and data gaps.
institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: Istituto Superiore di Sanità (ISS) & ANSES France

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Preparatory support for the statistical evaluation of the comparative assessment of GM plant field trials and for the evaluation of toxicological studies for GM plant food/feed safety.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The purpose for lot 1 is to provide statistical support to the EFSA GMO panel with respect to the statistical analysis of the collected data in relation to food and feed (FF) risk assessment according to the requirements described in the EFSA GMO panel STATS Opinion, incorporated in the FF GD and the Implementing Regulation (Regulation (EU) No 503/2013). The purpose for lot 2 is to provide preparatory support to the EFSA GMO panel for the evaluation of the compliance of toxicological studies, performed for the safety assessment of GM plants, to the appropriate standardised guidelines or to EFSA Scientific Committee guidance (2011b) as referred to in the Implementing Regulation (EU) 503/2013.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Preparatory support for the statistical evaluation of the comparative assessment of GM plant field trials and for the evaluation of toxicological studies for GM plant food/feed safety.

institution_data__INSTITUTION_NAME: National Food Institute, Technical University of Denmark (DTU)

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Machine learning techniques applied in risk assessment related to food safety.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: A scientifically-based evaluation of the potential use of machine learning techniques (MLT) should be elaborated to provide insights for the elaboration of a guidance document and to facilitate the harmonisation in EFSA's assessments.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Support to national dietary surveys in compliance with the EU menu methodology (fourth support).
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to award direct service contracts to organisations from EU Member States, and from Norway and Iceland which have a governmental mandate to carry out a dietary survey at national level in the period from 2014 to 2019. Under the resulting contracts the contractor(s) should either adapt or develop the methodology to be used in these surveys according to the EFSA EU menu methodology. The dietary data collected through the contracts should be available for EFSA's scientific activities without restrictions on its use.

project__PROJECT_TITLE: Preparatory work for the scientific opinion on welfare assessment of dairy cows in small-scale farming systems.
project__PROJECT_OBJECTIVE: The aim of this procurement procedure is to conclude a direct service contract for data collection for the description of European small-scale farms (SSFs) based on size, farming system and husbandry practices and categorisation of SSF based on quantified welfare risks.
